text: the University of Kentucky is launching a new beginner Farmers training program alongside the Pike County Cooperative Extension Service the program is designed to properly introduce new Farmers to the agricultural industry and help them build their skills and network with other Farmers best of all it's completely free to those interested this is a training program for brand new Farmers so if you're uh you know say fresh out of college or you know they said it's good something for veterans or just anybody that's a very new interested in commercial farming this is something that uh it's excellent opportunity lots of Hands-On workshops help you with marketing um anything vegetable small fruit production livestock it's excellent for for New farmers if you're especially if you're within you know one to three years just now beginning this is an excellent opportunity for for that kind of person journey into the extraordinary Blast Off from any of our three locations Co run keny or South Williamson Hideway novelty smoke and vape farmers will also receive one-on-one mentoring sessions so they can receive proper feedback applications are due February 1st they're looking for someone who is focused and very serious about commercial farming um any anyone who is willing to put in the hours and put in the work and take advantage of this uh training program like I said it's a wonderful opportunity for anybody that that's willing to uh put in the hours and participate they will provide oneon-one business marketing training anything related to commercial production or vegetables or livestock and the taken field trips you can go and um Mentor a farmer um really really uh help you get started and and help you in uh farming reporting for Mountaintop news I'm Nick Colum
